meanings.definition: In a manner that shows annoyance or offense
meanings.sent1: She stomped away huffishly after being told she couldn't have any more cookies.
meanings.sent2: He sighed huffishly when his little brother accidentally knocked over his tower of blocks.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the dog huffishly when it tried to play with its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The clouds moved huffishly across the sky, as if upset by the wind's constant pushing.
meanings.sent5: The teacher huffed huffishly at the students' constant chatter, trying to regain their attention.

meanings.definition: With a haughty or arrogant attitude
meanings.sent1: The princess walked huffishly past the villagers, her nose in the air.
meanings.sent2: He gave a huffishly dismissive wave of his hand when asked to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The peacock strutted huffishly around the garden, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion stood huffishly on the hill, looking down on the town below.
meanings.sent5: Her huffishly elegant dress caught everyone's attention at the ball, making her the center of admiration.
